content: The analytical “scientist” of the 19th century saw human rights as a crime against the cool calculating natural darwinistic blade of evolution. The bureaucrats of ancient times saw poverty and slavery as a necessary social linchpin in terms of wealth distribution and labor. You make a similar myopic mistake, unable to escape the clean and insipid values you grew up with. The future is not made by what the elite few see as sanitary, clean, perfect. But rather by a balancing act between what the wide majority accept and what the super powerful impose.
